csharp_simple:
1using System;
2using System.Collections.Generic;
3​
4namespace TechnicalIndicators
5{
6 /// <summary>
7 /// Displaced Moving Average (DMA)
8 /// </summary>
9 /// <remarks>
10 /// A Simple Moving Average shifted forward (or backward) in time.
11 /// <list type="bullet">
12 /// <item><description>Useful for aligning the MA with price action or creating support/resistance zones.</description></item>
13 /// </list>
14 /// </remarks>
15 public class DisplacedMovingAverage
16 {
17 public int Period { get; }
18 public int Displacement { get; }
19 public List<decimal?> Values { get; } = new();
20​
21 public DisplacedMovingAverage(int period = 20, int displacement = 5)
22 {
23 Period = period;
24 Displacement = displacement;
25 }
26​
27 public void Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles)
28 {
29 Values.Clear();
30 var candleList = new List<CandleData>(candles);
31 if (candleList.Count == 0) return;
32​
33 // Step 1: Calculate Standard SMA
34 var sma = new List<decimal?>();
35 decimal sum = 0;
36​
37 for (int i = 0; i < candleList.Count; i++)
38 {
39 sum += candleList[i].Close;
40 if (i >= Period)
41 sum -= candleList[i - Period].Close;
42​
43 if (i < Period - 1)
44 sma.Add(null);
45 else
46 sma.Add(sum / Period);
47 }
48​
49 // Step 2: Displace (Shift)
50 // If displacement is positive, we take value from (i - Displacement).
51 // This shifts the plot to the *Right*. (Wait, usually +Displacement pushes it forward).
52 // Logic check: "Displaced Moving Average" usually means shifting the MA *forward*.
53 // If I am at time T, I want to see the MA value from T-D? No, that's Lag.
54 // If I shift forward, at time T, I plot the MA value calculated at T-D.
55 // Let's verify standard definition.
56 // "Displaced +5": Code says values[i] = sma[i - 5].
57 // If i=100, we show sma[95]. This delays the signal (Right Shift).
58 // This matches the implementation provided.
59​
60 for (int i = 0; i < candleList.Count; i++)
61 {
62 int srcIdx = i - Displacement; // Negative displacement? usually positive int provided.
63 if (srcIdx >= 0 && srcIdx < sma.Count && sma[srcIdx].HasValue)
64 Values.Add(sma[srcIdx]);
65 else
66 Values.Add(null);
67 }
68 }
69​
70 public static List<decimal?> Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles, int period = 20, int displacement = 5)
71 {
72 var dma = new DisplacedMovingAverage(period, displacement);
73 dma.Calculate(candles);
74 return dma.Values;
75 }
76 }
77}
csharp_detailed:
1// =============================================================================
2// Logic Breakdown (DisplacedMovingAverage)
3// =============================================================================
4//
5// This document provides a "Deep Dive" into the internal logic of the
6// Displaced Moving Average (DMA) technical indicator.
7// We explain *why* code is written this way and *how* data transforms
8// line-by-line, targeting programming beginners.
9//
10// [Core Concepts]
11//
12// 1. Moving Average (SMA)
13// [Why] To smooth out price noise and see the trend.
14// [What] The arithmetic mean of the last 'Period' closing prices.
15//
16// 2. Displacement (Time Shift)
17// [Why] Standard MAs can "lag" behind price or cut through price too often.
18// Shifting the MA can align it better with market cycles or volatility support.
19// [What] Taking the calculated SMA value and plotting it 'Displacement' bars forward.
20// [How] Output[i] = SMA[i - Displacement]
21//
22// [Visual Plan]
23// Period = 3, Displacement = 2
24//
25// Day: 1 2 3 4 5 6
26// Price: 10 11 12 13 14 15
27// SMA: null null 11 12 13 14
28// ↓ ↓ ↓ ↓
29// (Shift 2 days forward)
30// ↓ ↓ ↓ ↓
31// DMA: null null null null 11 12
32//
33// =============================================================================
34​
35using System;
36using System.Collections.Generic;
37​
38namespace TechnicalIndicators
39{
40 // =============================================================================
41 // Logic Explanation: OHLCV Data Container
42 // =============================================================================
43 public readonly record struct CandleData(DateTime Timestamp, decimal Open, decimal High, decimal Low, decimal Close, long Volume);
44​
45 // =============================================================================
46 // Logic Explanation: Displaced Moving Average Class
47 // =============================================================================
48 public class DisplacedMovingAverage
49 {
50 // -------------------------------------------------------------
51 // Logic Explanation: Configuration
52 //
53 // [Period] Standard window for SMA calculation.
54 // [Displacement] How many bars to shift the SMA forward.
55 // Positive = Curve moved to the right (lagging).
56 // Negative = Curve moved to the left (leading).
57 // -------------------------------------------------------------
58 public int Period { get; }
59 public int Displacement { get; }
60 public List<decimal?> Values { get; } = new();
61​
62 // =============================================================================
63 // Logic Explanation: Constructor
64 // =============================================================================
65 public DisplacedMovingAverage(int period = 20, int displacement = 5)
66 {
67 if (period <= 0)
68 throw new ArgumentOutOfRangeException(nameof(period), "Period must be greater than 0");
69 Period = period;
70 Displacement = displacement;
71 }
72​
73 // =============================================================================
74 // Logic Explanation: Main Calculation Method
75 //
76 // [Why] Two-phase process:
77 // 1. Calculate the base SMA series.
78 // 2. Copy values from the SMA series with an index offset (displacement).
79 // =============================================================================
80 public void Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles)
81 {
82 // -------------------------------------------------------------
83 // Step 1: Cleanup
84 // -------------------------------------------------------------
85 Values.Clear();
86 var candleList = new List<CandleData>(candles);
87 if (candleList.Count == 0) return;
88​
89 // -------------------------------------------------------------
90 // Step 2: Phase 1 - Calculate SMA
91 //
92 // [Why] (Intent)
93 // We need a complete series of SMA values first.
94 // Using a separate list 'sma' acts as a buffer.
95 //
96 // [Optimization]
97 // Using "Rolling Sum" (Sliding Window) for O(N) efficiency.
98 // NewSum = OldSum + NewPrice - OldestPrice
99 // -------------------------------------------------------------
100 var sma = new List<decimal?>();
101 decimal sum = 0;
102​
103 for (int i = 0; i < candleList.Count; i++)
104 {
105 // Add incoming price
106 sum += candleList[i].Close;
107​
108 // Remove outgoing price (if window is full)
109 if (i >= Period)
110 {
111 sum -= candleList[i - Period].Close;
112 }
113​
114 // Calculate Average
115 if (i < Period - 1)
116 {
117 // Not enough data yet
118 sma.Add(null);
119 }
120 else
121 {
122 // Full window available
123 sma.Add(sum / Period);
124 }
125 }
126​
127 // -------------------------------------------------------------
128 // Step 3: Phase 2 - Apply Displacement
129 //
130 // [Why] (Intent)
131 // Shift the calculations to their final display position.
132 //
133 // [Logic]
134 // We want the value at 'Today' (index i) to be the SMA from 'Displacement' days ago.
135 // sourceIndex = i - Displacement
136 //
137 // Example (Displacement = 5):
138 // At i=20, we look at sourceIndex=15.
139 // Output[20] = SMA[15]
140 // -------------------------------------------------------------
141 for (int i = 0; i < candleList.Count; i++)
142 {
143 int srcIdx = i - Displacement;
144​
145 // -------------------------------------------------------------
146 // Step 3a: Bound Checking
147 //
148 // [Decision]
149 // Is the source index valid?
150 // 1. Must be >= 0 (can't look before start of data).
151 // 2. Must be < Count (can't look into non-existent future).
152 // 3. SMA value must exist (not null).
153 // -------------------------------------------------------------
154 if (srcIdx >= 0 && srcIdx < sma.Count && sma[srcIdx].HasValue)
155 {
156 Values.Add(sma[srcIdx]);
157 }
158 else
159 {
160 Values.Add(null);
161 }
162 }
163 }
164​
165 // =============================================================================
166 // Logic Explanation: Static Convenience Wrapper
167 // =============================================================================
168 public static List<decimal?> Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles, int period = 20, int displacement = 5)
169 {
170 var dma = new DisplacedMovingAverage(period, displacement);
171 dma.Calculate(candles);
172 return dma.Values;
173 }
174 }
175}
python_simple:
1class DisplacedMovingAverage:
2 """
3 Displaced Moving Average (DMA)
4 SMA shifted by X periods.
5 """
6 def __init__(self, period=20, displacement=5):
7 self.period = period
8 self.displacement = displacement
9 self.values = []
10​
11 def calculate(self, candles):
12 self.values.clear()
13 if len(candles) == 0: return
14​
15 # 1. Calc SMA
16 sma = []
17 s = 0.0
18
19 for i in range(len(candles)):
20 s += candles[i]['close']
21 if i >= self.period:
22 s -= candles[i - self.period]['close']
23
24 if i < self.period - 1:
25 sma.append(None)
26 else:
27 sma.append(s / self.period)
28
29 # 2. Shift
30 for i in range(len(candles)):
31 src_idx = i - self.displacement
32
33 if src_idx >= 0 and src_idx < len(sma) and sma[src_idx] is not None:
34 self.values.append(sma[src_idx])
35 else:
36 self.values.append(None)
37​
38def calculate(candles, period=20, displacement=5):
39 dma = DisplacedMovingAverage(period, displacement)
40 dma.calculate(candles)
41 return dma.values
python_detailed:
1# =============================================================================
2# Logic Breakdown (DisplacedMovingAverage)
3# =============================================================================
4#
5# This document provides a "Deep Dive" into the internal logic of the
6# Displaced Moving Average (DMA). We explain *why* code is written this way
7# and *how* data transforms line-by-line, targeting programming beginners.
8#
9# [Core Concepts]
10# 1. Displacement (Time Shift)
11# A standard SMA is shifted forward (positive displacement) or backward
12# (negative displacement) in time.
13# - Positive Displacement (+D): Moves the line to the right. Used to align
14# lagging MA with current price action or create support/resistance bands.
15#
16# 2. Simple Moving Average (SMA)
17# The underlying calculation is a standard SMA.
18#
19# =============================================================================
20​
21​
22# -------------------------------------------------------------
23# Type-Level Explanation: DisplacedMovingAverage (class)
24#
25# [Why] Encapsulates SMA calculation + shifting logic.
26# [What] Shifted time series generator.
27# [Who] Trend traders, Ichimoku (uses this idea heavily).
28# [Where] Heap allocation.
29# -------------------------------------------------------------
30class DisplacedMovingAverage:
31​
32 # -------------------------------------------------------------
33 # Constructor: __init__
34 #
35 # [Why] Configure lookback AND shift amount.
36 # [What] displacement=5 means "take today's SMA and plot it 5 days ago"
37 # OR "plot today's SMA 5 days in the future" depending on perspective.
38 # In this implementation: Input[i] -> Output[i+displacement].
39 # But usually DMA displays SMA[i-disp] at i.
40 #
41 # Logic here: Result[i] = SMA[i - displacement]
42 # Example: If i=10 and disp=5, Result[10] returns SMA[5].
43 # This effectively shifts the SMA plot to the RIGHT (Future).
44 # -------------------------------------------------------------
45 def __init__(self, period=20, displacement=5):
46 if period <= 0:
47 raise ValueError("period")
48 self.period = period
49 self.displacement = displacement
50 self.values = []
51​
52​
53 # =============================================================================
54 # IPO: calculate
55 # =============================================================================
56 #
57 # [Input]
58 # - candles: list[dict]
59 #
60 # [Process]
61 # 1. Calculate standard SMA array.
62 # 2. Shift the array by 'displacement'.
63 # - Value at index `i` becomes `SMA[i - displacement]`.
64 # - This means current output looks at PAST SMA value (Lagging effect if D>0).
65 #
66 # [Output]
67 # - None (populates self.values).
68 # =============================================================================
69 def calculate(self, candles):
70
71 # -------------------------------------------------------------
72 # Logic Step 1: Reset
73 # -------------------------------------------------------------
74 self.values.clear()
75 if len(candles) == 0:
76 return
77​
78 # -------------------------------------------------------------
79 # Logic Step 2: Calculate Standard SMA
80 #
81 # [Why] (Efficiency)
82 # Use O(N) sliding window sum to compute SMA first.
83 # This creates the base series that we will then shift.
84 #
85 # [How] (Logic)
86 # Add new price, remove old price (if window full).
87 # -------------------------------------------------------------
88 sma = []
89 s = 0
90
91 for i in range(len(candles)):
92 s += candles[i]['close']
93
94 # Remove old value leaving window
95 if i >= self.period:
96 s -= candles[i - self.period]['close']
97
98 # Store SMA or None
99 if i < self.period - 1:
100 sma.append(None)
101 else:
102 sma.append(s / self.period)
103​
104 # -------------------------------------------------------------
105 # Logic Step 3: Apply Displacement (Shifting)
106 #
107 # [Visual]
108 # SMA: [10, 11, 12, 13]
109 # Disp: 2
110 # i=0: src=0-2=-2 (Invalid) -> None
111 # i=1: src=1-2=-1 (Invalid) -> None
112 # i=2: src=2-2=0 (Valid) -> SMA[0]=10
113 # i=3: src=3-2=1 (Valid) -> SMA[1]=11
114 # Result: [None, None, 10, 11]
115 # Effect: The values 10, 11 "arrived later" (shifted right).
116 # -------------------------------------------------------------
117 for i in range(len(candles)):
118
119 # -------------------------------------------------------------
120 # Logic Step 3.1: Calculate Source Index
121 #
122 # [Why] (Intent)
123 # Find which past SMA value corresponds to "now" given the shift.
124 # -------------------------------------------------------------
125 src_idx = i - self.displacement
126
127 # -------------------------------------------------------------
128 # Logic Step 3.2: Bounds Check
129 #
130 # [Decision]
131 # Is the source index valid (non-negative and within array)?
132 # AND Is the source value actual data (not None)?
133 # -------------------------------------------------------------
134 if src_idx >= 0 and src_idx < len(sma) and sma[src_idx] is not None:
135 self.values.append(sma[src_idx])
136 else:
137 self.values.append(None)
138​
139​
140# =============================================================================
141# Static Wrapper Function
142# =============================================================================
143#
144# [Why]
145# Functional interface.
146#
147# [Pattern: 3-Step Static Wrapper]
148# =============================================================================
149def calculate(candles, period=20, displacement=5):
150 # 1. Instantiation
151 dma = DisplacedMovingAverage(period, displacement)
152
153 # 2. Execution
154 dma.calculate(candles)
155
156 # 3. Extraction
157 return dma.values
